programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth's plan to sell the Pontiac shop hits a snag and Ashley is pulled into the fray, and a meeting with a potential buyer leaves them facing a life-changing situation.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les struggles to forgive Seth for trying to sell his business and decides to lock himself in the office. Meanwhile, a fight breaks out on the shop floor.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists ask whether a currently unidentified species represented in human DNA could be a result of breeding between man and alien in the distant past.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether aliens that once visited Earth deliberately left a series of clues that mankind was eventually meant to decipher. Many ancient sites, and even recent ones like Roswell, all seem to be associated with reports of something coming down from the sky. Tsoukalos' research demonstrates that many of these places share a common symbol or shape-concentric circles. What is the significance of these designs, and is it possible they contain a coded message left by alien visitors?.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Auctions in Garland bring a day of dashed hopes and sweet profits. Plus, a new buyer begins to throw some of the bidders off their game.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head to Fort Worth, where a local auctioneer stirs up trouble when he joins as bidder.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les faces a dilemma over the authenticity of a rare guitar and, with no expert on hand for advice, he is forced to go with his gut instinct.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley reacts to some bad manners in the shop queue, a kooky cowboy arrives at the counter and Rich makes an error that could cost him his job.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick struggles to maintain his tough negotiating skills when offered a 1974 Volkswagen, and the team examines a Second World War fighter plane.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The gang sizes up some signed presidential memoirs and a toy of Robbie the robot from the movie Forbidden Planet - but questions the value of a can of fake elephant manure.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The latest round of auctions prompts a career-changing bid from Ivy, while Jarrod and Brandi's Long Beach store is mired in gossip.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go to Murieta, California, where Jarrod and Brandi hope to turn their recent run of misfortune around.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: After facing a hostile reception at an auction in New Jersey, Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1960s skeet-throwing machine and an antique carriage.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a rifle with a matching cutlass bayonet, as well as a bowling pin-setter, at an auction in California and hope to strike a deal that will result in a profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba's nemesis Kenny Stowe shows up at tense auctions in Mesquite, where struggling Victor proves he is desperate for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa Lewis and Jerry Simpson compete against Jenny Grumbles and Mary Padian at an auction on their own turf in Longview.

programme.title: Air Emergency
programme.desc: Enter the incredibly complex world of the airport, where the slightest error can result in catastrophe. Plus, visit the worldâ€™s most extreme airports, where only the most highly skilled and specially trained pilots are allowed to approach..

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto searches for and tests several possibilities that may explain the mystery and phenomena of Superhuman strength.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Expert investigations into the possibility that reptilian aliens are more than a pop-culture creation and a favourite of works of science-fiction.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds are forced to take action when they witness a hustler scamming their customers in the car park. Plus, Seth and Ashley finally come to blows.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Kane Hodder, an actor who played Jason Voorhees in four of the Friday the 13th films, comes to American Jewelry to have a gold pendant featuring his trademark hockey goalie mask.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Ashley must properly determine the value of a shoddy bike. Meanwhile, Seth enters into a conflict with a New Jersey man, and a customer desires a TV.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth plots to empty the overflowing warehouse behind Les's back, but risks upsetting his father.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones uncover a Swedish rifle and a golf ball retriever, and try to sell them at an auction in Panorama City.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: At a storage unit sale in Riverside, Ton Jones breaks the rules of auction hunting to take on a rival with shady bidding tactics.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Tony gets a heads-up about a King Air chopper available for a steal of a price. However, things look suspicious when the team goes to meet the seller.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: For a Good Time, Call Ivy
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi are under financial pressure, and fear they will lose one of their shops if they do not make a profitable bid soon.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have to break some bad news to the staff of one of their stores, while Rene tries to dominate his rivals.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: After facing a hostile reception at an auction in New Jersey, Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1960s skeet-throwing machine and an antique carriage.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a rifle with a matching cutlass bayonet, as well as a bowling pin-setter, at an auction in California and hope to strike a deal that will result in a profit.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Roisin Conaty and Frank Skinner are among the comedians at the mercy of Greg Davies, who sets them assorted challenges, including playing golf with eggs.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Fern Britton, Richard E Grant, Sanjeev Bhaskar and Martin Clunes join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Ruth Jones, Jason Manford, Jack Dee and Peter Serafinowicz join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: When the Dwarfers investigate a crashed ship at the bottom of an ocean moon, Lister and Cat become trapped together and Lister's nightmare begins. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer is taken prisoner on a planet where the inhabitants and landscape are created by his own mind and is subjected to a series of gruesome tortures devised by his imagination, leaving the rest of the crew to come up with a way to rescue him. Starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Chef Jordan Andino is on the hunt to find restaurants that reign supreme in the late-night food scene, meeting other chefs to taste their most popular dishes.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Jordan Andino visits Tucson, where chef Ramiro spends the day roasting a whole pig. His late night best seller is the Pasco Nachos, loaded with cheesy sauce and juicy pork.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank take picking to a whole new level when they come across people who are not afraid to go big when it comes to collecting.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Blackpool Pleasure Beach, where Nat and John gamble on a mode of transport, and an unpopular bargain hunter returns to the group.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In Oxford, John goes against his wife's advice and ends up in a conflict with Dan, while Linda thinks she has spotted something the other bidders are yet to see, and George and Rupert take a risk on mysterious items hidden under dust sheets. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team takes the BMW M3, Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG and Audi RS4 to Spain for a thorough test of performance. David Tennant is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, James May drives a Jaguar XF and Richard Hammond wonders what happened to that ultimate symbol of 1960s grooviness - the beach buggy.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Dozens of amateur racers hurtle through the Chilean capital of Santiago, with only gravity propelling their wacky homemade vehicles.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Cee'd through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports car's country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters square up to their Australian counterparts in an automotive version of the Ashes, with challenges including rallying, drifting and a double-decker car race. Jeremy Clarkson also test-drives the Ferrari 599 GTO, and Boris Becker gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an edition first broadcast in 2007, Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May celebrate British Leyland's 40th birthday by trying to boost the reputation of the cars that once rolled off its production line. The Aston Martin DBS is put through its paces on the test track, Jennifer Saunders is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car and the team asks whatever happened to the beach buggy.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy game show. Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson, Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson accept a potato-throwing challenge.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis, presenter Ben Fogle, newsreader Kate Silverton and Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood are this week's guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and comedians Rhod Gilbert, Rufus Hound and Miranda Hart are the guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer is taken prisoner on a planet where the inhabitants and landscape are created by his own mind and is subjected to a series of gruesome tortures devised by his imagination, leaving the rest of the crew to come up with a way to rescue him. Starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer finally tires of being embarrassed by his fellow crewmen, and decides to take his revenge by forcing them to spend 12 weeks in strict quarantine after they are exposed to a deadly virus. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Live at the Apollo Christmas Special
programme.desc: The BAFTA nominated comedy showcase returns for its third annual Christmas special, welcoming some of the biggest and best comedic talent to the stage for some Yuletide frolics. Previous editions have featured stand-up routines and compering from renowned comedians such as Ed Byrne, Nish Kumar, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Henning Wehn. This time, Canadian comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan hosts the show, welcoming former I'm A Celebrity contestant and stand-up comic Joel Dommett, and Bristol-born comedian and radio presenter John Robins to the stage.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests to dupe their opponents with plausible lies, featuring contestants including Ronnie Corbett, Bernard Cribbins, Richard E Grant, Jack Dee, Martin Clunes, Julian Clary and Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy game show. Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson, Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson accept a potato-throwing challenge.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
programme.desc: Neil Oliver leads the team to Cornwall and discovers the network of communication cables under Porthcurno beach. Miranda Krestovnikoff discovers how a shipwreck can be turned into a natural wildlife sanctuary, and Mark Horton visits the Isles of Scilly - known to some archaeologists as the Isles of the Dead.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part one of two. A re-examination of Jack the Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story known today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888. This documentary strips back decades of rumour and misinformation to reveal the true lives of the five women slain.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Documentary explaining how a squadron of low-flying bombers freed resistance fighters from Amiens Jail during the Second World War.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ghostly house in a tropical paradise that is still feared by the locals and a pioneering complex marked by both glory and tragedy that will soon to be lost forever.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: First hand accounts of America's opening air raid on the Japanese archipelago, led by Colonel Jimmy Doolittle.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A former dealer is selling his entire medal collection - will Dave and Steve find anything worth bidding for? And Steve digs deep into a WW1 army medic's family history.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team reinvestigates the work of serial killer James Jenson when the wallets of his victims surface on the day he is released from a secure psychiatric unit. However, after turning the spotlight on a second suspect, Dr Bruno Rivelli, and the children's home he previously ran, they find themselves with another murder case on their hands.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, Yvonne leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and Amber teases Dan Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: An unexploded bomb is discovered next door to Blackwall, which sparks a series of events for the Black Watch, culminating in a fatal fire.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A remote British-ruled island in the South Pacific is invaded and the King's Own Fusiliers find themselves part of the task force sent to retake it. Unfortunately, Corporal Hobbs is soon captured and tortured by enemy troops, and Colonel Eastwood's daring plan of attack has explosive consequences.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Butcher celebrates his forthcoming wedding to Stacey with a riotous stag party in France, but finds Continental hospitality losing its allure after a transport strike strands him on the wrong side of the Channel. While Steve Evans pulls out all the stops to get his friend to the church on time, Dr Sarah Eastwood faces an agonising romantic dilemma and Chris comes to a momentous decision.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, Yvonne leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and Amber teases Dan Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie treats a patient who used to bully her at school - and a few other facts about her past come to light. Elliot decides not to apply for the clinical lead job, but Ric asks him to reconsider. Donna and Mickie clash while working together on Keller, and Lola is concerned Mark is getting too emotionally involved in a case.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sam questions his future at the hospital during his recovery from the attack, while bed manager Adam wonders whether he should return to nursing, and a management training team courts disaster while competing on an assault course. Starring Derek Thompson and Jonathan Kerrigan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gita gives Ian some advice, and Grant and Phil rescue Nigel from his birthday blues. Jules makes a confession to Dot, and Michele is suspicious of a blossoming new friendship.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: There is some unexpected news at the Taverniers.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The propane cylinder storage depot blaze continues, leaving Jaffa badly burned and plunging George into agonies of guilt. Nick clashes with Skase over how to handle the emergency, and later learns to his dismay that Ariadne has gone missing, while on a quieter note, Recall and Laura enjoy a break from the children. Andrew Kazamia, Glen Murphy, and Richard Walsh star.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie faces losing the estate as he struggles to find a way to pay off Hector's death duties, and Greg capitalises on the situation by offering to buy the property - but just when all seems lost an affluent traveller offers a solution to the predicament. Meanwhile, Irene's secret past threatens to destroy her relationship with Duncan.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger returns to Skelthwaite on a mission to find his long-lost father. Simon takes radical steps to thwart business rival Conrad Walker's plans, and Anna makes a decision about the baby's upbringing. Drama, starring Tony Haygarth, Leslie Ash and Lesley Dunlop.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian's mooning over a new love, Joey's mooning over an old one and Jack's completely besotted with Leonora.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The new boss makes his presence felt in the holiday camp with a spate of sackings. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel moves in with Jean, but each has trouble letting go of their independence. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo shocks everyone by making an effort to dress smartly in an attempt to woo a lady. Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo is shocked when a single mother, fighting a lawsuit against the mobile phone company she blames for her incurable cancer, asks her to take care of her son after she dies. Presiding in the case, Deed finds himself at the centre of a plot between the phone company and Sir Ian Rochester, both of whom are eager to have him out of the way.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An unknown tagger begins to paint graffiti around London, and claims to have been responsible for killing a celebrated street artist four years previously. Originally part of a gang, the victim went solo after receiving support from a wealthy art patron, and when the detectives reopen the case, they become suspicious of his resentful former crew members. Meanwhile, Brian signs up to a social networking site as TopCop999 to chart the gritty life of a lawman, much to his colleagues' displeasure.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team investigates after a man convicted of murdering his parents escapes from a psychiatric unit and reveals the location of a decomposed corpse. The remains are identified as those of a student who went missing in the 1960s, and a link is made between the two crimes. However, time is of the essence in tracking down their suspect when an elderly psychiatrist is taken captive.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win Â£25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Ruth Langsford, Eamonn Holmes, Joe Swash and Stacey Solomon discuss the challenges of being a celebrity couple and how they have built and maintained successful relationships.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by chef Galton Blackiston for a tour of Cornwall. They sample some world-class ice cream before visiting Newlyn fish market to buy cod, which James cooks with oysters and tartare sauce. The trip concludes with a visit to Sennen beach, where they practice their oil painting and break out the barbecue.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five members of a Surrey bowling club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The presenter embarks on her favourite countryside walk through the rolling plains of Cheshire, a trail with eight counties on show, two castles to explore and spectacular views across to Wales and Liverpool. A popular route for dog-walkers and sports, her trek proves to be full of surprises.

programme.title: Tales from the Coast with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor meets people who share his passion for the British coast, beginning with north Devon, a 90-mile stretch of shoreline that holds fond childhood memories for him. Robson starts his adventures by visiting the popular seaside resort of Ilfracombe, a town that stills attracts thousands of visitors every summer, to experience the classic British day out by the sea. After spending a night under canvas, he takes a boat ride to the port of Clovelly, a village that evokes the character and atmosphere of a bygone age, and visits the island of Lundy.

programme.title: Return to Belsen
programme.desc: Jonathan Dimbleby returns to the site of the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp on the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the survivors by British troops. Jonathan's father was with the Allied forces as a reporter, and his account was one of the first to bring the full horrors of the Holocaust to the world's attention. Featuring contributions from survivors, liberators, and their children.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having previously toured their own countries, Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix now hit the highways of of the States - although in the first episode, they are in Mexico, on a mission to taste the world's best breakfast. Along the way, the trio take part in a chili-eating competition, have a beach buggy race and watch some traditional Mexican wrestling - but it isn't long before they are persuaded not take part.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Despite Kate being sued after an accident in the cafe, she refuses to back down and Koji is reluctant to get involved. Although Medium is convinced she should just apologise and get it over with, Kate suspects the legal threats may have something to do with Councillor Bone. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: John appeals to members of the Trenchards' staff in his bid to uncover the truth about Charles, while Turton and Ellis are quick to betray their employers and prove surprisingly adept at deceit and spying. Susan makes a seemingly miraculous discovery, and begrudgingly agrees to accompany Anne and James to their country estate in the hope of extracting further information about Oliver. Stephen makes a last-ditch attempt to secure the funds he needs to pay off his debt - a deal that puts his life in danger.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Humvee to work on, and he and Edd China create a four-wheel-drive camping vehicle capable of venturing to places no camper has been before.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton is tasked with creating a display based on the French Resistance - a parachute basket filled with items the RAF would have dropped to the Resistance during the Second World War.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Sr learns Mikey is in rehab and wonders if there is any hope of salvaging their relationship. Meanwhile, the team turns its attention to building a trike for a client.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy risks an emergency landing on an Alaskan glacier, while Danny Thompson frees a $1.8million business jet from its hanger - by hand.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on the sticky task of tofu making, and finds out what happens when a TV monitor is destroyed.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes of manufacturing wooden garage doors and making animatronic dinosaurs are put under the microscope.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Grammy Awards/Bike Lights/Above-Ground Pools/Foldable Solar Panels
programme.desc: The technology behind the manufacture of Grammy Awards, bike lights, above-ground pools and foldable solar panels.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in cooling the iconic Sydney Opera House. Plus, an insight into how Sheffield steel is transformed into a carpenter's handsaw, and the production of a microphone capable of picking up a whisper.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien assess sewing machines in Kent as they continue their journey across the UK to find unique and valuable items 'lost' in people's homes.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Skippers Sig and Phil try to exchange their deckhands in a high-seas transfer, but the operation does not go smoothly.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Emily struggles to discipline her divers on the Eroica, and Shawn battles a crew that is blocking his way.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Rolls-Royce but takes a chance when offered a 1984 Bentley Mulsanne Turbo, much to the dismay of Edd China when he sees the paintwork.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China tries to renovate a Triumph Spitfire sports car so Mike Brewer can sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues to renovate the Triumph Spitfire, replacing the differential and rear shock absorbers and having the bumpers and handles chromed.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: After chasing one for 38 years, Wayne Carini finally acquired a Hudson Italia from a woman called Hazel, who might have more surprises in store for the enthusiast.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his three Ferraris, a 1971 Daytona Coupe and a 1972 Dino GT to the Amelia Island auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Vehicle restorer Wayne Carini looks out for a BMW Isetta for his newly married daughter at the Bruce Weiner Microcar Museum sale.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A 1937 Packard Convertible catches Wayne Carini's eye as he looks around an auction of unusual vehicles.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard spots a 1960s Mini that may be for sale - can he buy it at a good price? Plus, a Cotswold dealer has a Porsche 928, but the budget is hit by some major repairs.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove continue their search through Britain's sheds in search of vintage treasure to restore and sell for a tidy profit. In Surrey, they find Pontiac ambulances, mysterious automotive sculptures and strangely well-preserved motorbikes.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove are off to Cornwall. They meet a collector whose cottage is like a transport museum, chock-full with memorabilia, penny farthings and lights of all description - watched over by Buster, the guard rabbit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to Ypres in Belgium looking for items from the Great War. He tracks down a German trench mortar and also goes for a ride in a First World War-era British tank - one of the first tanks ever used in combat.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Edinburgh, where he discovers an antique shop with a deluxe 1940s American bike. Later, he finds a mid-century designer desk in Wookey Hole.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard's artisan restorers rescue a ravaged carousel horse dating from before the First World War. Plus, they revive a valuable 1930s sofa and a 100-year-old weathervane.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Humvee to work on, and he and Edd China create a four-wheel-drive camping vehicle capable of venturing to places no camper has been before.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole tries to restore a monkey bike, and Simon O'Brien makes use of all his skills as he tries to give new life to an old racing bicycle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hunts for hidden treasures at a 400-year-old school in Cambridgeshire. Plus, the team takes a tour of one of the oldest paper mills in the United Kingdom.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Swansea, a huge barge is ripped apart. Meanwhile, in London, six tower blocks are demolished and on the south coast, scrap queens search for valuable scrap material.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a broken hand mirror containing the portrait of a mysterious French lady, and a painting of fog on the river Thames is also repaired.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The requirements that must be met to transform a family car into a rally car. Plus, the manufacture of titanium, the metal that the modern aerospace industry relies on.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Nuclear Sub/Crash Test Dummies/Fruit and Veg
programme.desc: How submarine crews survive being submerged beneath the ocean for months at a time. Plus, how crash test dummies make driving safer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China try to make a profit on their first electric project as they restore a 1985 Maserati Bi-Turbo that was converted to electric in the early 1990s.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic officers assist police to discover whether the deaths of three individuals on separate continents were caused by the same killer.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In February 2015, the body of 26-year-old Celina Petersen was found dumped in an alley in South Park, Seattle. When police recovered surveillance footage from across the neighbourhood, they began to unravel the shocking truth behind her murder.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of a respected Kentucky businesswoman, found bludgeoned and stabbed to death in her home. Detectives followed a long path to pursue her killer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.sub-title: The True Story of Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: The long investigation into the 1964 murder of three civil rights workers, which resulted in the conviction of seven Ku Klux Klansmen three years later.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated mare is rescued, and animal protection officers seize two Great Danes that were left home alone.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown heads to Coffs Harbour where he visits Dolphin Marine Magic, and explores one of the greatest friendships between man and animal.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nancy's father and uncle join in and help consultant Diane search for an ideal dress, while bride Nicole relies on her dad for a second opinion.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: From celebrity brides like Elle King to entourages featuring Kathy Griffin and Joan Rivers, Randy introduces his top star moments in the series.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown has an all-night marathon in a canine maternity ward, and a rabbit is hit with a bad case of heatstroke.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Series featuring vets from locations all over Australia, including Dr Peter Ricci, Dr Alex Hynes, Dr Kate Adams, Dr Lewis Hunt and Dr Danni Dusek. In this episode, Dr Kate discovers dachshund Gary has a life-threatening condition. Dr Alex is under pressure to deliver 12 puppies, and Dr Peter performs surgery on a lion.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: An investigator offers an ultimatum to the owner of eight emaciated dogs, telling her to take responsibility for their welfare or they will be taken away from her.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Officers are alerted to a Siberian tiger cooped up in a trailer, and deal with a house containing more than 30 cats living together in poor conditions. The police investigate a case of horse neglect and examine sick and injured poodles.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators search in abandoned cars and shallow graves to unearth vital pieces of evidence that criminals believe are safely hidden.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 30-year-old teacher and former beauty queen Tara Grinstead, who vanished from her Georgia home on October 24, 2005. An abandoned latex glove was found in her backyard and police learned she had enjoyed a complex series of relationships with men.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Kara Kopetsky, who failed to return home from her Missouri school in May 2007. As the investigation proceeded a few unsettling clues occurred - a restraining order was required against an ex-boyfriend, unconfirmed sightings were made in a nearby town and another local girl disappeared.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into the abduction of a 17-year-old from a shop near his home and the subsequent $30,000 ransom demands.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Christina longs for a lace gown, but her father hates the look, while consultant Flo has her hands full trying to please a 17-year-old bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Meg breaks Lori's number-one rule by bringing her fiance dress-shopping with her, while Kat has her heart set on a colourful gown, but her mother has other ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A woman clashes with her traditional family over a modern, form-fitting dress, while a bride's big sister tries to relive her own wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Carol wants to impress her husband in a sexy gown for their vow renewal ceremony, but her son disagrees on her choice of dress.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Narina fears she may have gained weight for her final fitting. Bride Leah's outspoken mother shocks Jo and Al, and there's a strange request for latex.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Pippa returns for her final fitting and is anxious about walking down the aisle. On the big day, Jo and Al arrive to find both bride and groom in meltdown.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors hunt for valuables in Avignon which they hope will sell for a profit in Bristol. Adrien picks up warehouse lights and Sam upcycles an old bicycle into three decorative clocks, while Juel looks to taxidermy to secure a profit. Expert dealer Mark Franks offers advice.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An insight into the world of high-end pawnbroking, going behind the scenes at a Surrey-based firm dealing in luxurious and exclusive objects.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part two of two. Updates on Laura and Chay's progress, with Laura scared about skin removal and Chay trying to maintain her weight loss now she has declared she is transgender.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: The Slaton sisters rely on each other and food for support. Amy, 31, wants to have children, but is unable to due to her weight. Tammy, 32, is almost bedridden.

programme.title: The World's Fattest Man - A Love Story
programme.desc: The former 'World's Fattest Man' Paul Mason seeks a surgeon to remove the excess skin after his 700lbs weight loss. As he struggles through his weight-loss journey, he finds love.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a boy and his mother who were kidnapped by a vicious drug cartel, and how the FBI prosecuted all the members of the gang through the use of surveillance.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic officers assist their police counterparts to recreate a bomb - which led to the death of a woman - to see if they can catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic officers use a brand new technique to catch a killer who attempted to conceal his tracks by incinerating the evidence.
